condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, communities have increased knowledge to resist shocks and recover from emergency situations

description.narrative: In 2019, in collaboration with the Ministry of Health, 7 million people were reached by key messages to prevent EVD through awareness campaigns held in public places including markets, fishing ports, schools, entry/control points, local churches and mosques. An Ebola Risk Communication and Community Engagement strategy was developed with the Ministry of Health and other key partners. UNICEF contributed to a comprehensive Malaria C4D Strategy with a "Schoolchildren against Malaria" engaging adolescents in three provinces. UNICEF received funding from DFID, SIDA and OCHA as well as UNICEF National Committees in the United Kingdom, Germany and France. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of people who participate in social and behavior change communication interventions (interpersonal communication) promoting elimination of VAC through UNICEF programmes
Number of people with access to information enabling them to deal with emergencies
Existence of coordination mechanism on Behavior Change Communication (C4D) and Risk Communication and Community Engagement (CREC)
